title: Flag: Clipperton Island

nouns: Emblem usually consisting of a rectangular piece of cloth of distinctive design
A flag is a piece of fabric with a distinctive design that is used as a symbol, as a signaling device, or as decoration.
A piece of cloth, often decorated with an emblem, used as a visual signal or symbol.
Piece of fabric with a distinctive design

Clipperton Island is an uninhabited coral atoll in the eastern Pacific Ocean, 1080 km south-west of Mexico, 2424 km west of Nicaragua, 2545 km west of Costa Rica and 2260 km north-west of Galapagos Islands, Ecuador, at.

description: The flag for Clipperton Island, which may show as the letters CP on some platforms. Uses the same flag as France.
apple_vendor_description: On Apple devices, the Clipperton Island flag emoji unfurls with crisp detail, showcasing its distinct blue field and a simplified white cross. Apple's rendering imbues the flag with a subtle 3D effect, suggesting a gentle breeze and the realistic texture of fabric, enhanced by soft rounded edges. This specific flag, a unique representation on Apple devices, signifies the geographical location of Clipperton Island and can be used in contexts related to geography, travel, or specific regional discussions.
